intro: Oenothera leptophylla, commonly known as the slenderleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oval seeds. Oenothera leptophylla is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
